argClause.description: A command-line argument definition for the task.

usage.description: A one-line summary of the argument.
usage.title: usage

values.description: A predefined set of acceptable values to provide for the argument.
values.title: values

argsClause.description: The set of command-line arguments that must be provided to the task.

commandClause.description: The command or commands to execute using the global interpreter.

commandItem.description: The command to execute using the global interpreter.

exec.description: The command to execute using the global interpreter.
exec.title: exec

print.description: The text that will be printed when the command is executed.
print.title: print

quiet.description:
Whether to silence the text/hint before execution.
Command output will still be printed.
quiet.title: quiet

defaultClause.description:
The default value to use if the value is not otherwise set.
If multiple values are provided, the first `when` that evaluates to true will be used as the default value, with an omitted `when` always considered true.
defaultClause.title: default

defaultItem.description:
A default value to use if the value is not otherwise set.
If a `when` clause is provided, the value will be used if and only if the condition evaluates to true.

command.description:
A command to run via the global interpreter.
The value of stdout will be used as the value.
command.title: command

option.description:
A command-line option for the task.
Options may be set by CLI flag, environment variable, or a configured default value, in that order.

environment.description: An environment variable that can be used to set the value.
environment.title: environment

private.description: Whether the option is configurable by CLI or environment variable.
private.title: private

rewrite.description: The text to use for interpolation for boolean values.
rewrite.title: rewrite

short.description:
The one-letter option name.
Short flags can be passed using a single hyphen (e.g., -a) or combined with other short flags (e.g., -abc).
short.title: short

usage.description: A one-line summary of the option.
usage.title: usage

values.description: A predefined set of acceptable values to provide for the option.
values.title: values

optionsClause.description: The set of command-line options that may be provided to the task.

setEnvironmentClause.description: The environment variables to either set or unset.

subTaskClause.description: A sub-task to run as a part of the outer task definition.

args.description: The argument values to pass to the sub-task.
args.title: sub-task args

name.description: The name of the sub-task to run.
name.title: sub-task name

options.description: The option values to pass to the sub-task.
options.title: sub-task options

include.description: The relative file path to the yaml task definition.
include.title: task include

description.description: The full description of the task. This may be a multi-line value.
description.title: task description

finally.description: Logic to execute after a task's run logic has completed, whether or not that task was successful.
finally.title: task finally

private.description: Whether the task can be ran directly.
private.title: task private

quiet.description:
Whether to silence the text/hint before execution.
Command output will still be printed.
quiet.title: task quiet

usage.description: A one-line summary of the task.
usage.title: task usage

tasksClause.description: The list of defined tasks available.

value.description: The value of an arg or option.

valueList.description: A set of possible values for an arg or option.

whenClause.description:
A condition that controls whether its outer clause runs or not.
Each individual item in the list of when clauses must pass for the check to be considered successful.

command.description:
A command to run via the global interpreter.
The when clause will be considered a success if any of the commands exit with a status code of 0.
command.title: when command

environment.description:
A set of environment variable values to check.
The when clause will be considered a success if any environment variable matches any of the provided values.
environment.title: when environment

equal.description:
A set of arg or option values to check.
The when clause will be considered a success if any arg or option matches any of the provided values.
equal.title: when equal

exists.description:
A set of files to check for existence.
The when clause will be considered a success if any of the files exist.
exists.title: when exists

not-equal.description:
A set of arg or option values to check negatively.
The when clause will be considered a success if any of the arg or option values do not match any of the provided values.
not-equal.title: when not equal

not-exists.description:
A set of files to check for non-existence.
The when clause will be considered a success if any of the files do not exist.
not-exists.title: when not exists

os.description:
A set of operating systems to check against.
The when clause will be considered a success if the current OS matches any of the provided operating systems.
os.title: when os

interpreter.description:
The interpreter to use for commands.
The interpreter is specified as an executable, which can either be an absolute path or available on the user's PATH, followed by a series of optional arguments.
The commands specified in individual tasks will be passed as the final argument.
interpreter.title: interpreter

name.description: The alias name to display in help text when using shell aliases to create a custom named CLI application.
name.title: name

options.description:
Shared options available to all tasks.
Any shared variables referenced by a task will be exposed by command-line when invoking that task. Shared variables referenced by a sub-task will be evaluated as needed, but not exposed by command-line.
Tasks that define an argument or option with the same name as a shared task will overwrite the value of the shared option for the length of that task, not including sub-tasks.
options.title: shared options

usage.description: The usage text to display in help text when using shell aliases to create a custom named CLI application.
usage.title: usage
